content: black cat basics mitts black cat basics patterns are designed for beginner knitters who want to make something they will actually want to wear the basics mitts use purl in addition to knit stitch and are knit flat with no increasing or decreasing they come in sizes toddler-men s large and are a wardrobe staple that even experienced knitters will want to make and wear © alanna penk 2020 construction black cat basics mitts are knit flat from the top down using garter stitch knit on both sides and rib stitch for the wrists knit and purl they are then sewn up the side seam using a tapestry needle materials needed malabrigo rios yarn or similar 10ply/worsted weight yarn to achieve gauge colour pictured frank ochre you will need approx 44 54 70 88 110 124 124 144 162 metres/ 48 60 76 96 120 136 136 158 178 yards total 4mm/us size 6 straight or circular needle s mitts are worked flat tapestry needle for finishing gauge 11 stitches and 24 row= 5cm/2in in garter stitch 14 stitches and 16 row= 5cm/2in in 2x2 rib stitch abbreviations co= cast on k= knit p= purl sts= stitches sizing mitts are intended to be worn with zero ease to choose your size measure around your hand and choose the finished measurement that most closely matches sizes toddler child small child large women s small women s medium women s large men s small men s medium men s large finished measurements hand circumference 12 5 15 16 5 18 19 20 20 21 5 23 cm/ 5 6 6 5 7 7 5 8 8 8 5 9 in length 10 11 5 12 5 14 15 16 5 16 5 18 19 cm/ 4 4 5 5 5 5 6 6 5 6 5 7 7 5 in © alanna penk 2020 instructions garter stitch hand using long-tail cast on co 28 32 36 38 40 44 44 48 50 sts row 1 k work row 1 a total of 26 30 34 38 40 44 44 46 50 times all sizes except women s small and men s large 2x2 ribbed wrist row 1 k2 p2 repeat in brackets to end of row work row 1 a total of 14 16 18 20 22 24 24 26 -
